data.event: The town was named for Sir Henry Lawrence, hero of the Lucknow military campaign of 1857, and is billed as "The Gateway To Central Otago".

event.title: 1877, a branch line railway was built

data.event: In 1877, a branch line railway was built from the Main South Line to Lawrence, and the town remained the terminus of the line until an extension was built in 1910.

The railway closed in 1968 and the town's station has subsequently been demolished, but some relics still remain, including the goods shed.
